Rule.Name: f2013MSI
Rule.Query: $n4DigitSKUVersion='2013' and $.='MSI'

Rule.Name: fEvernote
Rule.Query: ../Instance/Setting[@Key1='__KEYPATH' and contains(Value,'EvernoteOL.Connect')]

Rule.Name: fEvernoteWow
Rule.Query: ../Instance/Setting[@Key1='__KEYPATH' and contains(Value,'EvernoteOL.Connect')]

Rule.Name: sEvernoteCrash
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion>14 and $fEvernote and starts-with($.,'Evernote')
Rule.Title: Evernote add-in has caused one or more crashes in Outlook
Rule.Text: A third-party add-in called Evernote.Outlook is installed and has caused Outlook to crash. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions...' link for details on how to disable this add-in.

Rule.Name: sEvernoteCrashWow
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion>14 and $fEvernoteWow and starts-with($.,'Evernote')
Rule.Title: Evernote add-in has caused one or more crashes in Outlook
Rule.Text: A third-party add-in called Evernote.Outlook is installed and has caused Outlook to crash. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions...' link for details on how to disable this add-in.

Rule.Name: sFaultWWLib15045351507
Rule.Query: starts-with(lower-case($.),'wwlib') and ($nFaultingModuleVersion='15.0.4535.1507')
Rule.Title: Crashing issue with Wwlib.dll 15.0.4535.1507 found
Rule.Text: A crashing issue in Outlook.exe that was caused by Wwlib.dll (version 15.0.4535.1507) was found in the application event log. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sRedemption
Rule.Query: starts-with(lower-case($.),'redemption') and (number(substring($nFaultingModuleVersion,1,1))<5 or (number(substring($nFaultingModuleVersion,1,1))=5 and number(substring($nFaultingModuleVersion,3,1))<2))
Rule.Title: Crash caused by redemption.dll
Rule.Text: This version of redemption.dll ({0}) has some known issues

Rule.Name: sFaultOlmapiKB2837618
Rule.Query: starts-with(lower-case($.),'olmapi32') and ($nFaultingModuleVersion='15.0.4551.1003') and $OfficeUpdates_sKB2837618Installed
Rule.Title: Crashing issue with Olmapi32.dll 15.0.4551.1003 found
Rule.Text: A crashing issue in Outlook.exe that was caused by Olmapi32.dll (version 15.0.4551.1003) was found in the application event log. This occurs when the update from KB2837618 is installed. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sFaultAPLZOD32Crash
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=15 and starts-with(lower-case($.),'aplzod32')
Rule.Title: Crashing issue caused by APLZOD32.dll found
Rule.Text: A crashing issue in Outlook.exe that was caused by third-party dll (APLZOD32.dll) was found in the application event log. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details on a resolution.

Rule.Name: sThirdPartyFaultModulenot14
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion<14 and not($sFaultingModule='umoutlookaddin.dll' or $sFaultingModule='colleagueimport.dll') and not(contains($sFaultModuleCompanyName,'Microsoft'))
Rule.Title: Outlook crash due to third-party module: {0} on: {2}
Rule.Text: To resolve this issue, make sure Outlook is up-to-date. If the problem continues, update the software/add-in related to this dll file. For reference, the third-party vendor is: {1}.

Rule.Name: sThirdPartyFaultModule1415
Rule.Query: ($n2DigitVersion=14 or $n2DigitVersion=15) and not($sFaultingModule='umoutlookaddin.dll' or $sFaultingModule='colleagueimport.dll') and not(contains($sFaultModuleCompanyName,'Microsoft'))
Rule.Title: Outlook crash due to third-party module: {0} on: {2}
Rule.Text: To resolve this issue, make sure Outlook is up-to-date. If the problem continues, update the software/add-in related to this dll file. For reference, the third-party vendor is: {1}.

Rule.Name: nFaultMsvcr90Ox00059e89
Rule.Query: count(../Instance[Setting[@Key1='Faulting Module Name' and (starts-with(lower-case(Value),'msvcr90.'))] and Setting[@Key1='Fault offset' and (lower-case(Value)='00059e89')]])

Rule.Name: sFaultMsvcr90Ox00059e89
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=14 and $nFaultMsvcr90Ox00059e89>0
Rule.Title: Outlook crashing issue with Msvcr90.dll found
Rule.Text:
A crashing issue in Outlook.exe that was caused by Msvcr90.dll was found {0} times in the application event log over the last 14 days. This problem has been known to be caused by a corrupt nickname cache.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: nFaultNRTMsgLibn
Rule.Query: count(../Instance/Setting[@Key1='Faulting Module Name' and (starts-with(lower-case(Value),'nrtmsglibn'))])

Rule.Name: sFaultNRTMsgLibn
Rule.Query: ($n2DigitVersion=12 or $n2DigitVersion=14) and $nFaultNRTMsgLibn>0
Rule.Title: Outlook crashing issue with NRTMsgLibn.dll found
Rule.Text: A crashing issue in Outlook.exe that was caused by NRTMsgLibn.dll was found {0} times in the application event log over the last 14 days. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sOutlookCrashFound12
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=12 and $nCrashCount!=0
Rule.Title: One or more crashing events for Outlook found in the Application Event log
Rule.Text:
At least one crashing event for Outlook was found in the Application Event log. To possibly address this issue, we recommend you check your scan results for known crashing issues and resolve any that are found. If Outlook continues to crash:
1. Make sure Outlook is up-to-date (check your OffCAT report). 2. Try disabling COM add-ins
For additional troubleshooting techniques, click the 'Tell me more...' link and skip to the 'Can you reproduce the problem' section in the referenced article.

Rule.Name: sOutlookCrashFound1415
Rule.Query: ($n2DigitVersion=14 or $n2DigitVersion=15) and $nCrashCount!=0
Rule.Title: One or more crashing events for Outlook found in the Application Event log
Rule.Text:
At least one crashing event for Outlook was found in the Application Event log. To possibly address this issue, we recommend you check your scan results for known crashing issues and resolve any that are found. If Outlook continues to crash:
1. Make sure Outlook is up-to-date (check your OffCAT report). 2. Try disabling COM add-ins
For additional troubleshooting techniques, click the 'Tell me more...' link and skip to Step 3 in the referenced article.

Rule.Name: nKB2931904Crash
Rule.Query: count(../Instance/Setting[@Key1='Fault offset' and (lower-case(Value)='00025b09')])

Rule.Name: sKB2931904CrashMSI
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=15 and $nInstallType='MSI' and $OfficeUpdates_sOffice2013SP1NotInstalled and $nKB2931904Crash>0
Rule.Title: Crashing issue when using the Calendar found in your application event log {0} times
Rule.Text:
When you use your Outlook calendar the application may unexpectedly crash. This is a known issue that has been fixed.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for information on installing this fix.

Rule.Name: sKB2931904CrashC2R
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=15 and $nInstallType='ClickToRun' and versioncompare($C2R_Updates_fInstalledC2RVersion,'15.0.4569.1507')<0 and $nKB2931904Crash>0
Rule.Title: Crashing issue when using the Calendar found in your application event log {0} times
Rule.Text:
When you use your Outlook calendar the application may unexpectedly crash. This is a known issue that has been fixed.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for information on installing this fix.

Rule.Name: nKB2935154CrashMod0000
Rule.Query: count(../Instance[Setting[@Key1='Faulting Module Version' and (Value='0.0.0.0')] and Setting[@Key1='Fault offset' and ((lower-case(Value)='00862a1b') or (lower-case(Value)='004429bb') or (lower-case(Value)='003729bb') or (lower-case(Value)='00142b73') or (lower-case(Value)='00192b73'))]])

Rule.Name: nKB2935154CrashMod45511004
Rule.Query: count(../Instance[Setting[@Key1='Faulting Module Version' and (Value='15.0.4551.1004')] and Setting[@Key1='Fault offset' and ((lower-case(Value)='00b329bb') or (lower-case(Value)='006229c4') or (lower-case(Value)='003529c2') or (lower-case(Value)='009d29bb') or (lower-case(Value)='002f29bb'))]])

Rule.Name: nKB2935154CrashMod44201017
Rule.Query: count(../Instance[Setting[@Key1='Faulting Module Version' and (Value='15.0.4420.1017')] and Setting[@Key1='Fault offset' and ((lower-case(Value)='00b92b73') or (lower-case(Value)='00272b79'))]])

Rule.Name: nKB2935154CrashMod45511511
Rule.Query: count(../Instance[Setting[@Key1='Faulting Module Version' and (Value='15.0.4551.1511')] and Setting[@Key1='Fault offset' and (lower-case(Value)='002529ab')]])

Rule.Name: nKB2935154CrashMod45691503
Rule.Query: count(../Instance[Setting[@Key1='Faulting Module Version' and (Value='15.0.4569.1503')] and Setting[@Key1='Fault offset' and (lower-case(Value)='00365ec0')]])

Rule.Name: sKB2935154Crash
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=15 and ($nKB2935154CrashMod45691503>0 or $nKB2935154CrashMod0000>0 or $nKB2935154CrashMod45511004>0 or $nKB2935154CrashMod44201017>0 or $nKB2935154CrashMod45511511>0)
Rule.Title: Known crashing issue (KB 2935154) detected
Rule.Text: The crashing issue documented in KB 2935154 has been detected. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below to see the most recent details on this issue.

Rule.Name: nKB2936309CrashMod45511004
Rule.Query: count(../Instance[Setting[@Key1='Faulting Module Version' and (Value='15.0.4551.1004')] and Setting[@Key1='Fault offset' and (lower-case(Value)='0030a181')]])

Rule.Name: nKB2936309CrashMod45691503

Rule.Name: nKB2936309CrashMod45511511

Rule.Name: sKB2936309Crash
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=15 and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'15.0.4605.1000 ')<0 and ($nKB2936309CrashMod45511004>0 or $nKB2936309CrashMod45691503>0 or $nKB2936309CrashMod45511511>0)
Rule.Title: Known crashing issue when collapsing calendar groups detected (KB 2936309)
Rule.Text: The crashing issue that occurs when you collapse a calendar group (documented in KB 2936309) has been detected. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below to get the update that resolves this problem.

Rule.Name: sKB2817468Crash

Rule.Title: Outlook crashing issue with Igd10mud32.dll found
Rule.Text:
A crashing issue in Outlook.exe that was caused by Igd10umd32.dll was found {0} times in the application event log. This problem has been known to be caused by an outdated Intel graphics accelerator driver.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: n3427850Crash_382383016
Rule.Query: count(../Instance[Setting[@Key1='Faulting Module Version' and (Value='15.0.4535.1507')] and Setting[@Key1='Fault offset' and (lower-case(Value)='00096cc0')] and Setting[@Key1='Faulting Module Name' and (lower-case(Value)='wwlib.dll')]])

Rule.Name: n3427850Crash73121181932

Rule.Name: s3427850CrashModWwlib
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=15 and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'15.0.4631.1000')<0 and ($n3427850Crash_382383016>0 or $n3427850Crash73263998663>0 or $n3427850Crash73196258780>0 or $n3427850Crash73121181932>0)
